translation.en: [woman] When I was a kid, it was, like, have you ever had Lucky Charms,
translation.ja: 私が子供の頃は コーンフレークで

translation.en: and you pour out the Lucky Charms and you get, like, a bowl of cereal and three marshmallows,
translation.ja: １つの器に３つ入る マシュマロみたいだった

translation.en: That's what it felt like to me, that there were three Asian-American marshmallows.
translation.ja: アジア系アメリカ人の割合は それくらいよ

translation.en: The Yellow Ranger in Power Rangers...
translation.ja: 「パワーレンジャー」の…

translation.en: The Yellow Power Ranger...
translation.ja: イエロー

translation.en: Data from The Goonies was one of my favorites.
translation.ja: 「グーニーズ」のデータ

translation.en: Margaret Cho on All-American Girl...
translation.ja: マーガレット･チョー

translation.en: Michelle Kwan in figure skating.
translation.ja: ミシェル･クワン

translation.en: I thought maybe Lois Lane could be mixed race,
translation.ja: 「スーパーマン」の ロイス･レイン

translation.en: -like I am. -Captain Planet.
translation.ja: 「スーパーマン」の ロイス･レイン 「キャプテン･プラネット」

translation.en: [interviewer] Captain Planet is Asian?
translation.ja: アジア人？

translation.en: Not Asian, but there was an Asian character who had a dolphin friend.
translation.ja: イルカと友達の アジア人キャラが出てくる

translation.en: The Baby-Sitters Club is a series of books that came out in the 80's and 90's.
translation.ja: 80～90年代に出た シリーズ物の本よ

translation.en: [Sarah Kuhn] It follows a group of 13-year-old middle schoolers who are friends
translation.ja: 13歳の仲良しグループの 物語で

translation.en: and they decide to form a business by babysitting the local kids in their neighborhood.
translation.ja: 近所の子供を対象に 子守りの商売をするの

translation.en: They're really concerned about, um, quality child care...
translation.ja: 質の高い子供の世話に こだわっている

translation.en: which now seems, um...
translation.ja: サラ･カーン 子守りに熱中するなんて 今なら少し変よね

translation.en: a little odd that they-- that was like their passion: babysitting.
translation.ja: サラ･カーン 子守りに熱中するなんて 今なら少し変よね 子守りに熱中するなんて 今なら少し変よね

translation.en: There's always a new incident or adventure.
translation.ja: 次々新しい事件が起きるの

translation.en: There's fun drama. There's boy drama, of course.
translation.ja: おかしなハプニングや 恋愛ドラマがね

translation.en: Stacey's going through an issue with her dad.
translation.ja: 父親との克服や 父親との克服や Ｃ･Ｂ･リー

translation.en: What's this jealousy when you think Mary has a new best friend?
translation.ja: 友達に彼氏ができた時の 嫉妬もあった

translation.en: Going shopping, babysitting, spending time with her friends,
translation.ja: 買い物 子守り 友達との時間

translation.en: going on cruises to Disney World.
translation.ja: ディズニーランドへの旅

translation.en: The Baby-Sitters Club was my childhood.
translation.ja: 私の子供時代そのもの 私の子供時代そのもの ナイア･ククコブ 私の子供時代そのもの

translation.en: I had...
translation.ja: 自宅に本を収集してた だけじゃない

translation.en: not only a really big collection of Baby-Sitters Club books at home,
translation.ja: 自宅に本を収集してた だけじゃない ユミ･サクガワ 自宅に本を収集してた だけじゃない

translation.en: I also would check them out at the library periodically
translation.ja: 定期的に図書館で借りてた

translation.en: and even, like, check out old favorites.
translation.ja: 旧作シリーズもね

translation.en: I voraciously read through a good chunk,
translation.ja: むさぼるように読んだよ

translation.en: primarily through the Scholastic Book Club orders.
translation.ja: 最初は学校の共同購入に 注文してね 最初は学校の共同購入に 注文してね フィル･ユー

translation.en: [sighs] Y'all know what that is, I mean...
translation.ja: 最初は学校の共同購入に 注文してね フィル･ユー 最初は学校の共同購入に 注文してね

translation.en: I was reading them. My friends were reading them.
translation.ja: 私も友達も皆 読んでた

translation.en: Once I got into it, it was like... drugs for me.
translation.ja: 一度ハマると 抜けられなくなった

translation.en: We've got the sleeping bag.
translation.ja: 寝袋も持ってるし

translation.en: I've got a bag. Um, I had a necklace.
translation.ja: バッグやネックレスもある

translation.en: I had t-shirts. There were dolls.
translation.ja: Ｔシャツや人形も

translation.en: I had a CD-ROM game.
translation.ja: 私はゲームを持ってて

translation.en: I spent many hours on it.
translation.ja: かなりやった

translation.en: We would call each other by those character names. We would try to dress like those characters.
translation.ja: 格好もマネて 登場人物の名で呼び合ってた

translation.en: Of course I was Claudia.
translation.ja: 私はクラウディア

translation.en: "Suddenly, I sat up. All I could think about
translation.ja: “さっと体を起こした”

translation.en: were Milky Way bars and Ring-Dings and Oreos.
translation.ja: “頭に次々と お菓子が浮かぶ”

translation.en: Those were going to be the subject of my next art project.
translation.ja: “これこそ 次の作品のテーマだ”

translation.en: I could see it so clearly, the series of pop art pieces:
translation.ja: “イメージが はっきりと浮かぶ”

translation.en: 'Junk-Food Fantasy by Claudia Kishi.'
translation.ja: “ジャンクフードの空想”

translation.en: The idea was brilliant. I couldn't wait to get started."
translation.ja: “すばらしいアイデアだ 早く始めたい”

translation.en: [Phil Yu] Claudia Kishi is vice president of The Baby-Sitters Club.
translation.ja: クラウディアは副部長で

translation.en: She's also Japanese American.
translation.ja: 日系アメリカ人だ

translation.en: She loves junk food. She loves art.
translation.ja: スナック菓子とアートが好き スナック菓子とアートが好き ゲイル･ギャリガン

translation.en: Kooky, eclectic, and... ahead of her time.
translation.ja: 変で 多趣味で 時代を先取りしてる

translation.en: I loved that she had hollowed-out books.
translation.ja: 彼女をマネして

translation.en: I feel like that's something I still want, is, like, hollowed-out books to-- to hide all of my candy.
translation.ja: 本をくり抜いて 中にお菓子を隠したい

translation.en: [Yumi Sakugawa] She's cool enough to have her own landline in her bedroom,
translation.ja: 自分の部屋に電話を 引いてるのも羨ましかった

translation.en: unheard of when you're a 13-year-old girl.
translation.ja: 13歳では聞いたことない

translation.en: Usually... um, the Asian character or the woman of color character
translation.ja: 普通ならアジア人や 有色人種のキャラに

translation.en: is the one you feel like you have to be, right?
translation.ja: 自分を重ねるよね

translation.en: If you're playing Harry Potter, you have to be Cho Chang.
translation.ja: 「ハリー･ポッター」の チャウとか

translation.en: Whereas I feel like Claudia is the one everyone seems to want to be.
translation.ja: でもクラウディアは 皆がなりたい存在なの

translation.en: "I love to dress in a way that some people
translation.ja: “町の人が とんでもないと言う―”

translation.en: here in Stoneybrook might call...
translation.ja: “町の人が とんでもないと言う―” “格好をするのが好き”

translation.en: outrageous."
translation.ja: “格好をするのが好き”

translation.en: "At the moment I'm wearing lavender plaid cuffed pants with suspenders..."
translation.ja: “ラベンダー色の格子柄 パンツに”

translation.en: "White tights with clocks on them."
translation.ja: “白タイツに時計をする”

translation.en: "I was wearing a man's paisley vest I found at a yard sale..."
translation.ja: “男物のベストを着て”

translation.en: "Huge pretend emeralds..."
translation.ja: “大きな偽物エメラルド”

translation.en: "Electric pink ankle boots."
translation.ja: “ピンクのブーツ”

translation.en: "I've got earrings shaped like Christmas tree lights that blink on and off."
translation.ja: “ツリーみたいに光が 点滅するイヤリング”

translation.en: Oh, my God.
translation.ja: すごい

translation.en: "Was it too much? I shook my head.
translation.ja: “やりすぎ？　いいえ”

translation.en: I looked great."
translation.ja: “イケてる”

translation.en: [Sarah Kuhn] Claudia's style to me is very, like, tween girl meets Asian auntie.
translation.ja: 少女とアジアのおばさんを ミックスしたような格好で

translation.en: I feel like Claudia... knew what hipster fashion was gonna be 20 years later.
translation.ja: 流行ファッションを 20年 先取りしていた

translation.en: For an Asian American, or any woman of color character,
translation.ja: アジア系や有色人種の 登場人物で

translation.en: to be the cool one is so unusual.
translation.ja: イケてる女は変わってる

translation.en: She is just a really awesome character
translation.ja: クラウディアは

translation.en: who I felt like kind of busted through all the model minority stereotypes.
translation.ja: マイノリティの典型を ぶち壊す存在だった

translation.en: "My family is conservative, but I'm wild.
translation.ja: “保守的な家族で 私は自由奔放”

translation.en: My sister and I have next to nothing in common.
translation.ja: “姉と私は全然似ていない”

translation.en: She's super smart and likes school.
translation.ja: “姉は優秀で 学校が好き”

translation.en: My parents think she's wonderful.
translation.ja: “両親は姉を褒める”

translation.en: I wouldn't admit this to just anybody,
translation.ja: “誰にも言ってないが”

translation.en: but I have a feeling that I'm a big disappointment to my parents."
translation.ja: “私は親に とても失望している”

translation.en: That was such a mood.
translation.ja: そうだよね

translation.en: That's like... That was such a, like... a big mood for, like--
translation.ja: 世の中にそういう傾向が あったから

translation.en: This is why I related to Claudia so much.
translation.ja: 私は共感したんだと思う

translation.en: Janine is like the kind of daughter that every...
translation.ja: ジャニーンは誰もが望む娘

translation.en: that I felt that, like, my mom would've wanted, and I was definitely not.
translation.ja: 母もそうだろうけど 私は全然違う

translation.en: And I... would constantly... have this specter of... the perfect daughter...
translation.ja: 完璧な娘という亡霊に ずっととりつかれていた

translation.en: kind of... hanging over me 'cause I felt very aware that I was not this person.
translation.ja: 自分がそうでないことに 気付いてたから

translation.en: I felt like Claudia. I wanted to follow my heart and do creative things.
translation.ja: クラウディアのように 創作活動がしたかった

translation.en: I wanted to do art. I wanted to draw. I wanted to write.
translation.ja: 絵を描いたり文章を書いたり

translation.en: Claudia was so... unapologetic about... who she was.
translation.ja: クラウディは堂々と 自分らしくいる

translation.en: She really showed that you could be an artist, that you could be creative.
translation.ja: アーティストになれると 教えてくれた

translation.en: Claudia Kishi was this role model that just... hit me exactly right.
translation.ja: 私にドンピシャの ロールモデルだった

translation.en: Like, "Oh, this is like a puzzle piece that fits right into my heart."
translation.ja: 私の心にぴったり はまった感じ

translation.en: "'The Lowells are prejudiced,' said Kristy in a rush.
translation.ja: “ローウェル家は差別する”

translation.en: 'Claud, they didn't like you because you're Japanese.
translation.ja: “日系の子を嫌い”

translation.en: Jessi, Mrs. Lowell wouldn't even let you in her house because you're African-American.'
translation.ja: “アフリカ系の子を 家に入れない”

translation.en: My mouth dropped open. I could feel my hands trembling and my cheeks burning.
translation.ja: “私はあきれ 手は震え 頬は紅潮した”

translation.en: 'That's-- That's not fair!'"
translation.ja: “不公平よ”

translation.en: Congratulations, Claudia.
translation.ja: おめでとう

translation.en: You just learned a few things about good old-fashioned racism.
translation.ja: 時代遅れの人種差別を 学んだんだね

translation.en: I thought about the cover of "Keep Out, Claudia!"
translation.ja: 印象的な表紙がある

translation.en: and I remember, like, it was her standing outside the door
translation.ja: ドアの外に立つ クラウディアが

translation.en: with these Trump-looking white kids
translation.ja: 白人の子供３人に にらまれている

translation.en: looking at her judgingly. I thought it was like,
translation.ja: 白人の子供３人に にらまれている これが本当だったらと 不安になった

translation.en: "What if these covers were really truthful?"
translation.ja: これが本当だったらと 不安になった

translation.en: I just thought, like, it'd be a great way to talk about some microaggressions.
translation.ja: 自覚なき差別を うまく語ってると思った

translation.en: Things that Asians have to deal with every day,
translation.ja: アジア系には日常茶飯事だが

translation.en: that Claudia probably would have to deal with, but they never addressed in the books.
translation.ja: こんなことが 本で描かれることはなかった

translation.en: There is definitely that quality of... um...
translation.ja: ステレオタイプというか

translation.en: I guess, othering, for sure, where that a lot of these stories are being told
translation.ja: 白人女性の視点で 書かれた物語では ひとくくりにされる

translation.en: from the perspectives of young white girls.
translation.ja: ひとくくりにされる

translation.en: They, you know, somewhat problematically made a point to describe her
translation.ja: 問題とも言えるくらいに 描写が決まっている

translation.en: as always having almond-shaped eyes and... um...
translation.ja: アーモンド形の目に黒い髪

translation.en: jet-black hair and super beautiful skin, even though she eats tons of junk food.
translation.ja: スナック菓子を食べていても 肌はすごくきれい

translation.en: [Phil] First time I read someone described as "almond-shaped eyes." And I was like, "What does that even mean?"
translation.ja: “アーモンド形の目”とは どういう意味かと思った

translation.en: In terms of racial representation it definitely, like...
translation.ja: 民族の表現という 観点で見ると

translation.en: How do I put this? I noticed that-- most of the people were white.
translation.ja: ほとんどの人が白人だと 気付いた

translation.en: [CB Lee] When you don't see yourself in media, when you don't see mirrors of yourself,
translation.ja: メディアに 取り上げられることがないと

translation.en: you go on thinking, "I'm broken," or... "I'm not normal," or "I don't exist."
translation.ja: 自分は普通じゃないとか 存在しないと思ってしまう

translation.en: These thoughts, they're kind of subconscious, but they, um...
translation.ja: 潜在意識のような形で あっても

translation.en: They're pervasive, especially when you go on thinking that the world...
translation.ja: 実は浸透しているものなの

translation.en: is-- When you perceive the world... as a world without you in it.
translation.ja: いつしか世界を 自分抜きで認識している

translation.en: I remember, um, the person with the really heavy cartoonish accent.
translation.ja: アジア系が漫画の口調で 出てきたことがあった

translation.en: And a lot of disposable side characters and things like that that.
translation.ja: 使い捨てにされる脇役も多い

translation.en: That sort of generalized sense of being othered in media,
translation.ja: メディアで一般化されている イメージは

translation.en: of being the perpetual foreigner, of never being American.
translation.ja: 永遠に外国人で アメリカ人ではない

translation.en: And I do remember that manifesting in school with every kid asking me where I was from, um,
translation.ja: 学校に行くと皆から 私の出身はどこか聞かれたり

translation.en: or pulling their eyes back to sort of, like, make fun of me.
translation.ja: 細目にして からかわれたりした

translation.en: So, I definitely remember, um, how it affected me in real life.
translation.ja: 現実の世界で いかに影響があったかよね

translation.en: As someone who grew up, like, with-- with a Thai mom and a white dad, um,
translation.ja: タイ人の母と白人の父を 持つ私は

translation.en: the Asian narratives I saw didn't always jive with my experience,
translation.ja: アジアの物語には 共感できなかった

translation.en: which contributed to my questions of identity.
translation.ja: それで独自性を考えるように

translation.en: So, seeing someone like Claudia,
translation.ja: だから独自の道を行く クラウディアに

translation.en: who was kind of forging her own path, definitely
translation.ja: だから独自の道を行く クラウディアに より自分に近いものを 感じたように思う

translation.en: helped me feel more connected to, um, my own identity.
translation.ja: より自分に近いものを 感じたように思う

translation.en: Just knowing there's not one way to be an Asian person.
translation.ja: アジア系の生き方は １つでない

translation.en: I can just be me and that's fine.
translation.ja: 自分らしくていい

translation.en: "I pulled out my box of 64 Crayola crayons with the sharpener.
translation.ja: 〝64色のクレヨンの箱を 出し〞

translation.en: I sighed with happiness, and then I began to draw.
translation.ja: “幸せなため息をつくと 描き出した”

translation.en: My beautiful butterfly was finished."
translation.ja: “美しいチョウが完成”

translation.en: "'Claudia!' Said Miss Packet sternly.
translation.ja: “パケット先生は怖い声で”

translation.en: 'Is this some kind of joke?'
translation.ja: “おふざけか聞いた”

translation.en: I could not answer her. If I had, I would have cried."
translation.ja: “泣きそうで 答えられなかった”

translation.en: So, Mimi hears about this incident. Mimi, of course, this...
translation.ja: 祖母のミミが聞きつける

translation.en: awesome grandma who totally gets Claudia,
translation.ja: クラウディアを理解していて

translation.en: who embraces Claudia's artsy side, and she's not gonna let this slide.
translation.ja: 孫の芸術家的な面を 放っておかない

translation.en: So she goes up to the teacher.
translation.ja: 先生に会いに行く

translation.en: "She said, 'Miss Packet,
translation.ja: “先生に頼んだ”

translation.en: I would like you please to respect my Claudia's intelligence and imagination.
translation.ja: “孫の知性と創造力を 尊重してと”

translation.en: You asked the children to draw themselves the way they see themselves,
translation.ja: “自分の姿という 先生の課題に”

translation.en: and my Claudia sees herself as a free spirit, like a butterfly.
translation.ja: “孫の自由な発想では 自分がそう見えるから”

translation.en: So, that is what she drew.'"
translation.ja: “チョウを描いた”

translation.en: Mic drop! Fuck, yes!
translation.ja: もう言うことなし！

translation.en: [laughs] Sorry, I didn't mean to swear. Um...
translation.ja: 興奮しすぎ

translation.en: Go, Mimi.
translation.ja: いいね

translation.en: It was such a beautiful story, especially...
translation.ja: とてもすばらしい物語よ

translation.en: since Asian American... children, they grow up being told by their elders to-- to not stand out too much,
translation.ja: アジア系アメリカ人の子供は 目立つなと言われて育つ

translation.en: to not create waves, to fit in with the crowd.
translation.ja: 大勢に合わせろと

translation.en: For an Asian American person I felt like it was... extra special,
translation.ja: だからアジア系の者には 最高に思えた

translation.en: the idea that we can... be our true selves and not... hide it from the world.
translation.ja: 隠すことなく 自分らしくいていいんだと

translation.en: Oh, my God.
translation.ja: すごくいい

translation.en: In 2013, I made a Zine called
translation.ja: ２０１３年に 小冊子を作った

translation.en: "Claudia Kishi: My Asian American and Female Role Model of the 90's."
translation.ja: 「90年代の理想～ クラウディア･キシ」

translation.en: It was just so exciting to see how it struck a chord with other Asian American women readers.
translation.ja: アジア系の読者から 共感を得てうれしかった

translation.en: It was sort of, like, magical to realize we'd all been having
translation.ja: それぞれ違う町に 住んでいるのに

translation.en: the same experience, you know, in different towns,
translation.ja: 同じ体験をしてるのが 不思議よね

translation.en: everywhere reading these books, before we had a way of connecting with each other.
translation.ja: 知り合う前から あちこちでこの本を読んでる

translation.en: You can always tell when somebody is a Claudia Kishi. There's a certain swagger and there's definitely...
translation.ja: クラウディア･キシと 呼ばれる人は堂々としている

translation.en: There's definitely a feeling of camaraderie
translation.ja: 明らかに仲間意識がある

translation.en: when you see another Asian girl that maybe doesn't fit that standard stereotype and,
translation.ja: ステレオタイプでない 子にはね

translation.en: at the end of the day none of us really fit the stereotype.
translation.ja: 当てはまる子なんて いないのよ

translation.en: Her legacy is that she's moved beyond just this character.
translation.ja: ただのキャラクターを 越えているのが遺産ね

translation.en: Kids who grew up in the 90's are now adults
translation.ja: 90年代の子供は大人になって

translation.en: making their way into the world, creating their own works.
translation.ja: 世の中に出て 独自の仕事をしている

translation.en: I am a comic book artist,
translation.ja: コミック作家で イラストレーター

translation.en: illustrator, all-around interdisciplinary artist.
translation.ja: コミック作家で イラストレーター 異分野でアート活動をしてる

translation.en: [Phil Yu] "Angry Asian Man" is a blog
translation.ja: 2001年にブログを始めた 2001年にブログを始めた 〝怒れるアジア男〞

translation.en: I started back in 2001.
translation.ja: 2001年にブログを始めた

translation.en: I'm working on The Baby-Sitters Club as a series with Netflix.
translation.ja: この本の映像化を 手掛けている

translation.en: I write books and comic books about Asian American superheroines.
translation.ja: アジア系アメリカ人女性の 英雄物を書いている

translation.en: I'm the graphic novelist currently working on The Baby-Sitters Club adaptations.
translation.ja: 今はこの本を グラフィック小説に脚色中

translation.en: I'm the author of The Sidekick Squad series.
translation.ja: 私の「サイドキック･ スクアッド」は

translation.en: It's about a group of queer teens that take on a corrupt government agency.
translation.ja: 腐敗した政府機関と戦う 同性愛者たちの物語よ

translation.en: "Fashion Forecasts" is a futuristic collection of intergenerational,
translation.ja: 世代を超えたアジア系 アメリカ人の

translation.en: intersectional Asian American fashion designs.
translation.ja: ファッションブックを作った

translation.en: Probably the biggest theme that connects my work is--
translation.ja: 私の仕事の最大のテーマは

translation.en: I call it "Asian girls having fun."
translation.ja: 楽しむアジア人女性ね

translation.en: I love to tell stories about friendship, fantasy,
translation.ja: 仲間と団結して 大きな存在になる

translation.en: being more than you are when you come together.
translation.ja: そういう物語を語りたい

translation.en: It's a way to have conversations about who you are as Asian Americans.
translation.ja: アジア系アメリカ人で あることを語り合える

translation.en: The girls are gonna be dealing with issues happening now.
translation.ja: 今の少女にも起きている

translation.en: You know, transgender rights, prejudices against same-sex parents...
translation.ja: 性の権利や 同性の親からの偏見

translation.en: The main characters are Chinese and Vietnamese like me,
translation.ja: 主役は私と同じ 中国とベトナム系で

translation.en: and she's bisexual like me.
translation.ja: バイセクシュアル

translation.en: [Gele] There's always gonna be a challenge to make sure
translation.ja: 常に挑戦していくことで

translation.en: that we're seen as more than just a fad or a sidekick.
translation.ja: 流行や親友で終わらない 存在にしたい

translation.en: [Sarah] You can be a main character. Have your own story.
translation.ja: あなたは物語の主人公に なれる

translation.en: You can tell your own story however you want.
translation.ja: どのようにも語れる

translation.en: [Phil] At some point I realized
translation.ja: 許しをもらわなくても 語れるし

translation.en: I didn't need permission to tell it or for someone else to tell it for me.
translation.ja: 許しをもらわなくても 語れるし 語ってもらえる

translation.en: I wanna see people like me doing cool shit. [laughs]
translation.ja: カッコいい同志を見たい

translation.en: [CB Lee] I remember hanging out with friends on the playground.
translation.ja: アジア系の少女が遊び場で

translation.en: Imagine, like, five or six Asian American girls.
translation.ja: ５～６人集まったら どうなるか

translation.en: We had that fight about who gets to be Claudia, because...
translation.ja: 誰がクラウディアかで もめた

translation.en: you know, we're so thirsty to be seen.
translation.ja: 注目されたかったのね

translation.en: We're thirsty for those crumbs of representation.
translation.ja: 代表者の残りくずだから

translation.en: We're tired of just having crumbs. We want the whole cookie.
translation.ja: 私たちも クッキー丸ごとがいい

translation.en: We're gonna go out and bake our own cookies
translation.ja: 自分のクッキーを焼き

translation.en: and put them out so everyone can enjoy them.
translation.ja: 世の中へ出し 楽しんでもらいたい
